column1: Chuck Schumer just tried to adjourn the Senate without a COVID deal.   And she wants to make him Majority Leader. #KYSen https://t.co/XX0kt8FcQJ

McGrath wants to eliminate the private sector from health care.   Imagine what dire straits we would be in if we were entirely reliant on govt to provide therapeutics and ultimately a vaccine for coronavirus. It’s like asking the DMV to build you a Corvette.   #TheKentuckyDebate

The only COVID bill Amy McGrath supports is Nancy Pelosi’s 1800 page radical liberal wish list.   A bill that would send more rescue funds to Puerto Rico than it would to Kentucky and give tax breaks to blue state millionaires. #KYSen #TheKentuckyDebate
Both Governor DeWine and Governor Hogan have criticized Amy McGrath for exploiting coronavirus.   Yet she continues to cast herself as the victim of her own attack ad? #KYSen https://t.co/3HSzBGcTKI
Mitch McConnell has delivered $11 Billion in federal help to Kentucky to fight the coronavirus. #KYSen https://t.co/YubSawjGFG

@AmyMcGrathKY Mitch McConnell has delivered $11 Billion in federal help to Kentucky to fight the coronavirus.   Sharing this op-ed considering you have such a hard time telling the truth.  https://t.co/u3T9r5ktvV

Mitch McConnell delivers:  $11 billion for Kentucky $5.3 billion in loans for Kentucky small businesses $3.2 billion in Economic Impact Payments for Kentucky families $97.7 million to increase coronavirus testing $10.3 million for community health centers https://t.co/V3v4mmydle
Finally the CARES Act bolsters the healthcare response to the coronavirus. It addresses supply and testing shortages fuels innovation and funds hospitals and healthcare providers.

I introduced legislation reflecting the task forces’ best ideas called the Coronavirus Aid Relief and Economic Security (CARES) Act. It became the foundation for our country’s largest economic relief legislation.

Every Kentuckian is feeling the effects of the #coronavirus. It’s a national health & economic emergency that demands action. The Republican-led Senate answered with the biggest rescue package in history and Kentucky will see at least $1.25B in relief. https://t.co/xqK4zgnBg1
